title: Burglary offenses; intent to commit therein a
context: [ยง708-812.5] Burglary offenses; intent to commit therein a crime against a person or against property rights. A person engages in conduct &ldquo;with intent to commit therein a crime against a person or against property rights&rdquo; if the person formed the intent to commit within the building a crime against a person or property rights before, during, or after unlawful entry into the building. [L 2006, c 230, pt of ยง2] COMMENTARY ON ยง708-812.5 Act 230, Session Laws 2006, added this section, defining the phrase &ldquo;with intent to commit therein a crime against a person or against property rights.&rdquo;
